Introduction
8:00 AM Check In
10:00 AM Pre-op
12:00 PM Post Surgery
2:00 PM X-Rays
4:00 PM Pharmacy
 

In a place like a hospital where human life is at the core of everything, it is critical that the network doesn’t skip a beat, keeping patients, families, nurses, doctors and administrative staff connected when it matters most. See the journey and consider how your enterprise resembles a distributed hospital environment.

Continue

Michael checks in at the hospital administration desk for his operation.

Meet Michael. After Michael has checked in at the hospital for his out-patient operation, he surfs the web on his Android phone via the hospital’s Wi-Fi network to save on data usage. He loves how quickly he can connect to Wi-Fi and how fast his favorite video loads as he watches to calm his nerves.

Patients expect the type of Wi-Fi network quality they have at home to stay connected with friends and family.

See the Technology Continue the Experience

Check In

Hotspot 2.0

Enables a seamless hand-in for authentication on a new Wi-Fi network.

Industry initiative to develop standards-based interoperable Wi-Fi authentication and handoff. Cisco is a strong supporter of the Hotspot 2.0 initiative.

  • Cisco Blog
  • Whitepaper

Aironet AP702W Series Access Point

Provides Tyler wireless connectivity with high-performance bandwidth, increased range and signal

802.11n dual-radio Access Point supporting 2 x 2 multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) technology providing at least six times the throughput of existing 802.11a/g networks

  • Data Sheet

Bonjour Gateway

Allows Tyler to connect to another computer across the university – Airprint, Apple TV and iTunes can all connect to Bonjour Services Directory

With Bonjour Gateway, Apple related services such as printers, computers, Apple TV, iTunes and other services can be accessed anywhere in the network.

  • At a Glance
  • Cisco Blog
  • Video

Catalyst 3850

This intelligent system enables wired and wireless access for Tyler while in his dorm

Combines both wired and wireless users on a single platform to enable the unified access One Network solution with simplicity, optimized performance and programmability Software support for IPv4 and IPv6 routing, Multicast routing, modular quality of service (QoS), Flexible NetFlow (FnF) Version 9, and enhanced security features

  • Cisco Unified Access: Helping Partners Reduce Complexity and Maximize Productivity
  • Wired and Wireless Convergence
  • Catalyst 350 Delivers High Quality User Experience with Simplicity

802.11r

Allows Tyler to stay connected no matter where he is across the university

802.11r optimizes the user mobile experience over wireless internet networks where the handshake with the new access point is done even before the client roams to the target access point.

  • Fast roaming with 802.11r

10:00 AMPre-op

Michael is taken to his pre-op room in a different wing of the hospital.

Michael meets nurse Janet and heads upstairs, seamlessly switching Wi-Fi connections. Inside the dense hospital infrastructure, he calls his wife who is on her way to meet him. The voice call using the licensed small cell inside the hospital.

Patients need a clear signal no matter how many concrete blocks or steel beams separate them from the outside world.

See the Technology Continue the Experience

Across Campus

Aironet AP1530 Series Outdoor Access Point

Allows Tyler to stay connected outside while going between his dorm and the lecture hall

Extending wireless coverage from Indoors to Outdoor, the 1530 can withstand the most rugged outdoor conditions. Has radio resource management, BandSelect to automatically take advantage of the 5 GHz band, and VideoStream for high quality video performance over Wi-Fi. Small enough and light enough to mount outdoors on streetlight poles or building facades.

  • Overview
  • Data Sheet

Outdoor Mesh

Allows Tyler to access data in outdoor areas of campus

A modularized wireless outdoor access point designed for use in a mesh network. The access point also supports wireless client access, point-to-point bridging, point-to-multipoint bridging, and point-to-multipoint mesh wireless connectivity.

  • At a Glance
  • Data Sheet
  • Outdoor Wireless Access Point Comparison Chart

12:00 PMPost-surgery

Out of surgery, Michael grabs his cell phone, which is still connected to hospital Wi-Fi, to update his Facebook status to let his friends know he’s doing alright.

Upon check-in on Facebook, Michael receives a $5 coupon for the gift shop downstairs. He also grabs his iPad tablet to catch up on urgent work emails.

Now more than ever, it’s critical for patients to be able to connect and work wherever they are within the hospital.

See the Technology Continue the Experience

Lecture Hall

Aironet 3700 Series Access Point

Provides Tyler high-performance bandwidth, increased range and signal in a client dense environment

The Cisco Aironet 3700 Series is designed for High Density Network Environments that utilize Mission Critical, High Performance Applications. Combining the latest Wi-Fi Standard, 802.11ac with HDX (High Density Experience) to provide enterprise-class reliability and wired-network-like performance in high density environments. Supports an integrated 802.11ac radio with three spatial streams and 80 MHz-wide channels for a maximum data rate of 1.3 Gbps.

  • Aironet 3700 Series Product Page
  • Top 7 Facts to Know about Cisco HD Experience Technology
  • CleanAir at the Applications Level

802.11r

Allows Tyler to stay connected no matter where he is across the university.

802.11r is a standard method that is optimizes the user mobile experience by maintaining connectivity across the wireless network. Fast roaming with 802.11r can allow clients to move between access points without breaking a session, a critical requirement for many applications.

  • Fast roaming with 802.11r

2:00 PM X-Rays

Nurse Janet connects her iPad tablet to the wireless network to show Michael and his wife x-rays.

Janet then emails Michael’s neighborhood pharmacy his prescription details and rushes out the door to check in on her other patients.

Nurses today expect seamless communication between multiple devices to increase productivity during their busy schedules.

Cisco Application Visibility and Control (AVC) solution

Provides Tyler the best user-experience while on the network viewing his favorite applications with application-aware network control.

Cisco Application Visibility and Control (AVC) solution – a suite of services in Cisco network devices that provides application-level classification, monitoring, and traffic control, to improve business-critical application performance, support capacity management and planning, and reduce network operating costs.

  • Rule the World of Application QoS...

4:00 PM Pharmacy

Michael and his wife head home from the hospital and to the pharmacy near their house to pick up his medication.

Once they walk inside the pharmacy, Michael’s phone picks up the pharmacy’s Wi-Fi signal and he receives an alert that his preferred toothpaste is on sale.

Target your patients.

Connected Mobile Experiences for Facebook Wi-Fi solution

Enables the coffee shop to obtain social media demographic info from Tyler.

The ability to capture new customers and keep existing customers by delivering more value is essential to continued growth in all customer-facing industries. Cisco Connected Mobile Experiences (CMX) allows customers to connect through your onsite Wi-Fi. It opens a direct channel of communication that lets you better understand and deliver what your customers want.
